page.title: 16School and Education
page.content: There are two schools in our area, one at Kirby Hill and the other in Skelton. Both schools arw voluntary controlled Church of England Schools. They both take children from 5 to 11. The children from Skelton are in the area of the Ripon Secondary Schools and are assessed under the Thorne Scheme for their suitability to attend the Ripon Grammar School but most parents ask for their children to attend the Secondary school in Boroughbridge which is a comprehensive school. It is this school, Boroughbridge High School, to which the children from Kirby Hill School transfer at the age of 11.
